text.*:
The Death of General Wolfe by Benjamin West. Oil on canvas, 1770.

List of conflicts in Canada is a timeline of events that includes wars, battles, skirmishes, major terrorist attacks, riots and other related items that have occurred in the country of Canada's current geographical area. A complete list of terrorist attacks can be found at list of terrorist attacks in Canada.

Contents

  • 1 Before the 17th century
  • 2 17th century
  • 3 18th century
  • 4 19th century
  • 5 20th century
  • 6 21st century
  • 7 See also
  • 8 References
  • 9 Further reading
  • 10 External links

Before the 17th century[edit]

  • 1003 Battle of Vinland (1003)
  • 1006 Skirmishes between Norsemen and Skræling, the ancestors of the Beothuk, at L'Anse aux Meadows
  • 1010 Battle of Vinland (1010)
  • 1577 Skirmishes between English sailors under Martin Frobisher and the Inuit on Baffin Island

17th century[edit]

Battle of Sorel in 1610
  • 17th century Beaver Wars
    • 1610 Battle of Sorel
    • 1628 Action of 17 July 1628
    • 1644 Action at Ville-Marie
    • 1649 Raid on St. Ignace and St. Louis
    • 1660 Battle of Long Sault
    • 1689 Lachine massacre
    • 1691 Battle of La Prairie
    • 1692 Mohawk Valley raid
  • 17th century Anglo-French conflicts

    • 1629 Siege of Baleine

    • 1692 Battle of Fort Vercheres
    • 1645 Battle of Fort La Tour

  • 1677 Battle of Port La Tour
  • 1689 – 1697 King William's War
    • 1689 Battle of the Lake of Two Mountains
    • 1690 Battle of Coulée Grou
    • 1690 Battle of Port Royal
    • 1690 Battle at Chedabucto
    • 1690 Battle of Quebec
    • 1693 Battle of Fort Albany
    • 1694 Capture of York Factory
    • 1696 Naval action in the Bay of Fundy
    • 1696 Raid on Chignecto

      • 1696 Siege of St. John's
      • 1697 Battle of Carbonear
    • 1697 Battle of Hudson's Bay

20th century[edit]

  • 1902 June 22: Toronto Streetcar Strike riot [1]
  • 1907 Anti-Oriental Riots
  • 1913 Vancouver Island War[2]
  • 1918 Conscription Crisis of 1917
  • 1918 Vancouver General Strike
  • 1919 Winnipeg General Strike
  • 1925 New Waterford Rebellion. See Davis Day.
  • 1931 Estevan riot
  • 1933 Christie Pits riot
  • 1935 Regina Riot
  • 1935 Battle of Ballantyne Pier
  • 1938 Bloody Sunday
  • 1939 - 1945 Second World War
  • 1939 - 1945 Battle of the Atlantic
  • 1942 - 1944 Battle of the St. Lawrence
  • 1942 Bombardment of Estevan Point lighthouse
  • 1944 Terrace Mutiny
  • 1945 Halifax riot
  • 1955 Richard Riot
  • 1967 Yorkville, Toronto riots[citation needed]
  • 1969 Murray-Hill riot
  • 1970 October Crisis
  • 1971 Gastown Riots
  • 1982 Squamish Five
  • 1983 Solidarity Crisis
  • 1985 Air India flight 182
  • 1990 Oka Crisis
  • 1990-1992 Strike, strike-breaking, and bombing at Royal Oak Mines in Yellowknife, NWT
  • 1993 Montreal Stanley Cup Riot
  • 1994 Vancouver Stanley Cup Riot
  • 1995 Gustafsen Lake Standoff
  • 1995 Ipperwash Crisis
  • 1997 - 2000 Wiebo Ludwig and his followers bomb wellheads in Alberta's oil country

21st century[edit]

  • 2006 Caledonia land dispute
  • 2009 Vancouver gang war
  • 2011 Vancouver Stanley Cup riot
  • 2012 Quebec student protests

Further reading[edit]

Main article: Bibliography of Canadian military history
  • Fryer, Mary Beacock (1996), Battlefields of Canada, Dundurn Press, ISBN 1-55002-007-2 
  • Fryer, Mary Beacock (1993), More battlefields of Canada, Dundurn Press, ISBN 1-55002-189-3 
  • Jeremy Black (2011). Fighting for America: The Struggle for Mastery in North America, 1519-1871. Indiana University Press. ISBN 978-0-253-35660-4. 
  • Granatstein, J. (2010). The Oxford Companion to Canadian Military History. Oxford University Press. ISBN 0-19-543088-3
  • P. Whitney Lackenbauer (2007). Battle grounds: the Canadian military and aboriginal lands. UBC Press. ISBN 978-0-7748-1315-0. 
  • Zuehlke, Mark (2006), Canadian Military Atlas: Four Centuries of Conflict from New France to Kosovo, Douglas & McIntyre, ISBN 978-1-55365-209-0
